title.narrative: Protection Monitoring activities for effective response management

description.narrative: The main objective of this UNHCR project provides life-saving protection Monitoring activities for effective response management. This protection monitoring project builds on the existing network in place for protection monitoring, such as the PRMN (Protection and Return Monitoring Network) and SPMS (Somalia Protection Monitoring System ), and is mainly aimed at identifying people exposed to various protection risks such as persons living with disabilities, survivors of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV), persons facing various human rights violations and older persons at risk. The project will directly benefit thirty-two thousand (32,000) displaced people in accessible districts of both the South West State and Jubaland regions, namely:-South West State: Bakool (Ceel Barde, Rab Dhuure, Tayeeglow, Waajid, Xudur,) Bay (Baydhaba, Buur Hakaba, Diinsoor, Qansax Dheere); and Jubaland: Lower Juba ( Afmadow, Badhaadhe, Jamaame, Kismaayo), Middle Juba (Bu'aale, Jilib, Saakow. In total, the project provides life-saving assistance to 32,000 people, including 7,997 women, 7,703 men, 8,303 girls, 7,997boys, and 4,500 persons with disabilities.
